page-tournament-details.shoes-information-nubbed: are characterized by a sole featuring numerous small, flat studs evenly distributed across the surface. They have a rather subtle profile, giving a structured appearance due to the many small protrusions, without the studs extending significantly from the sole.
page-tournament-details.shoes-information-cleaded: have a sole with round or conical cleats, which are larger and fewer in number compared to the nubs. They are evenly distributed and protrude more than the nubs, yet they appear more compact than the longer studs found in studded shoes.
page-tournament-details.shoes-information-studded: , on the other hand, feature longer, more prominent studs that can be either fixed or replaceable. These studs often come in different shapes—such as conical or sharp-edged—and are clearly separated from each other, creating a distinctive look.
